meta.title: Save Skyline Park • Napa's Open Space Under Siege

hero.subtext: 5.26 acres of taxpayer-owned flat land in our 850-acre wilderness park — gone for 185 low-income units. Fire base camp, archery ranges, pow wows, scouts, equestrian shows — all fucked.
hero.footerLine: Napa residents paid for this park. Gavin Newsom's state wants to flip it for developer kickbacks.

threat.label: FACT CHECK — NOV 2025
threat.heading:
STATE WANTS 185 UNITS
ON SKYLINE'S BEST FLAT LAND
threat.paragraph1: 5.26 acres along Imola Ave — the flat area we use for **pow wows, SCA events, Boy Scout camping, equestrian shows, BottleRock overflow, and fire crew base camps**.
threat.paragraph2: This is the same land taxpayers bought and preserved. County just bought the rest of the 874-acre park to "protect" it... while the state carves out this prime chunk for housing.
threat.paragraph3: Groundbreaking targeted for mid-2028 under Newsom's surplus land program. They'll charge the park thousands per day to keep using it until then. Next? The archery ranges. Then the rest.
threat.bullet1: Traffic nightmare on already busy Imola
threat.bullet3: Kills multi-use recreation for Napa families
threat.bullet4: Taxpayers get screwed twice — we paid for the land, now we lose it
threat.sources: Sources: Napa Valley Register (Nov 28, 2025 & Jul 12, 2025). Sierra Club opposed since 2022.

park.label: 850 ACRES OF NAPA TREASURE
park.heading: This is OURS
park.card1Description: Silverado Archers' 25 acres — NFAA ranges, tournaments, hunter prep. Family club since 1954.
park.card2Description: Pow wows, SCA, Boy Scouts, equestrian shows, BottleRock camping, open space for everyone.
park.card3Description: Proven wildfire staging area. Now they're proposing a new tax for "open space fire camps" while destroying this one.
park.closing: Bought and preserved by Napa citizens decades ago. Used by thousands every year.

archers.heading: We're not going quietly
archers.body: The club maintains 25 acres of championship ranges inside the park. Tournaments, 3D shoots, hunter series — all threatened. They badgered us out of opposing Measure Z. Now they're coming for the land we helped protect.
archers.attribution: — From the Archery Club email, Feb 2026

action.heading: 5 MINUTES TO FIGHT BACK
action.subtext: Copy, paste, send. Spread it. Save the park.
action.emailTemplate:
Subject: Save Skyline Park - Stop the 185-unit housing grab on public land

Dear [Media / Supervisor],

Napa's Skyline Wilderness Park is under direct threat. The state wants to build 185 dense affordable housing units on 5.26 acres of the flat event area we taxpayers own and use for archery, pow wows, scouts, equestrian, fire base camps, and more.

This is the same land we preserved. The county just bought the rest of the park to "protect open space" while this gets developed. Irony much?

We said no to Measure Z because the money didn't go to parks. Now they're punishing us by selling the park out from under us.

Please cover this story and help stop it. Contact the supervisors. Spread the word.

Skyline Park belongs to the citizens of Napa — not developers.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
Napa Resident / Silverado Archers supporter
action.footerLine: Tell them: Public land is not surplus. Fire base camp > housing.
action.footerLinkText: Napa County Board of Supervisors → napacounty.gov

footer.line1: © 2026 Save Skyline Park • Built by Napa residents who give a fuck about open space. Hosted at whenindoubtdont.github.io/saveskyline
footer.line2: Not affiliated with any government. Just taxpayers who remember when "public park" meant something.
